alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:44AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Souris River near Towner affecting McHenry County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Souris River near Towner. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1456.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flood problems begin with agricultural land and meadows affected. At 1456.2 feet, Secondary roads become covered with water. Farmers on the right side of the river looking downstream will be affected but little damage. Water bypasses gage at this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 1456.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain nearly steady through Friday and then begin a slow fall through early next week. - Flood stage is 1454.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1457.8 feet on 06/11/2013. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
